name: Paula Coleman
text: "Professional Staff! Atmosphere is so inviting! Casual but very Upscale! Absolute Delicious! All the food is bursting with flavor! A must....visit there facilities for lunch, cost is very reasonable for the large portion sizes. Everything is so tasty! Love, Love Love the crab toast and the brussel sprouts!" The management staff(Nicki and Rosco) is very warm! Also, check there bar out...(great staff and fun). The drinks are the BOMB and REAL Italian wine!

name: Pete Welch
text: Great meal. Quick and attentive service. Really nice and warm feel to the decor. The oysters with granita were something unique I had not had before and would definitely have again. Buckwheat crepe with pork belly was interesting and delicious. The scallops dish was beautiful and excellent.

name: Art Hogarth
text: The staff are great and very friendly!  the food was flavorful and well presented.  i have not had a bad meal here.  Check them out and enjoy the food!

name: Steve and Deana Chapman
text: Excellent atmosphere. Casual, yet upscale. The crab toast is delicious and ample to share as a starter. The duck breast was tender and juicy. The watermelon granita with fennel cookie was the perfect ending to a great meal. Reasonably priced for exceptional food.

name: Brent Cary
text: Great menu with unique items.  I asked the server to bring me her favorite item and it was one of the best ribeye steaks I have had.  The flavors were phenomenal. Great place to eat in Birmingham.

name: Anthony Staggs
text: My wife and I came to Pizitz on a whim and... WOW, we were blown away! Fero is where it's at on every level; the atmosphere, the staff, the food and drinks were completely above what we expected. We definitely recommend to any and everyone, especially couples looking for a laid back upscale experience

name: Edward DeMellier
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. We did have a couple of disappointments however. First, the oysters served with a horseradish granita was almost tasteless (they didn't charge us for the oysters after they asked how we liked them and we told the truth). After the meal was over we asked why we don't served bread, the answer was that they do if we had only asked. Otherwise our entrees were delicious and we will be back and be sure to ask for bread.

name: cam johnson
text: Ribeye was unbelievably good.  Lamb ravioli with ricotta rocked, our app was good too.  Service was good. Looking forward to returning.

name: Matthew Smith
text: Delicious... Had my birthday dinner here. Service was excellent and knowledgeable. Food was incredible (still dreaming of the Pork Osso Buco), cocktails were well done, and dessert was incredibly rich and chocolatey.

name: Ashley Teague
text: The food is outstanding and the only thing that could possibly be better than that is the incredible service. I love this place!

name: J C
text: Over salted and unimpressed.  I came in expecting something to challenge other Italian/Mediterranean restaurants in town, but came away unimpressed.  The bolognese was way over salted and nothing special, and the wine was overpriced and not unique.  I like Italian reds and the Caparzo Rosso is not unique or great.  I wanted to like this place, but I believe there are better options for similar prices.

name: Julie Sullivan
text: Stellar food in a modern setting. Pasta dishes are amazing. I loved the duck ragout and the braised lamb. My ribeye was cooked to perfection with gnocci and chantrell mushrooms. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable.

name: Greg Randall
text: Staff was knowledgeable & friendly, space was hip and had just the right level of noise, and the food was excellent -- well cooked/seasoned/considered.

name: Tena Diliberto
text: Delicious food and great service. We had a great meal!

name: Graham Hixon
text: Awesome adventurous Italian with fantastic staff. Never fails.

name: Todd Brownstein
text: I live in Bhm and a "foodie" friend was visiting from out of town on Sunday evening and looking for great meal to reconnect over! Unfortunately, theres a great gulf of fine dining on Sunday or Monday in the city. She was staying at the Elyton Hotel one block away (FABULOUS!) so we walked to the Patzits Food hall and THANKFULLY "Fero" keeps longer hours than the other stalls in the main hall. It was a fantastic experience from entrance to exit. The staff is welcoming and informed, and one of the owners "Charles" greeted us and watched over our two hour feast with (non-intrusive) zeal like a true restraunteur...both he and the food were delightful. The oysters with frozen granita were unexpected and divine, and her chicken with fall veggies and my scallops with an Egyptian spice sear were flawless! Even the coffee and and mascarpone beignets were exemplary. It was a grand meal in modernist restrained surroundings..exactly what we were seeking! !Bravo! "Fero" and welcome to Bhm! I'll be recommending your restaurant to everyone!

name: G. Everett Reeves
text: Amazing place with amazing food, staff, & service.

name: Timothy Gawne
text: Very good food and a nice atmosphere, but I'm not going back.  OK this seems minor, and I know that restaurants make a lot of money on wine, if I want a bargain on wine I'll go to Costco, but when you take a date to a nice restaurant, and the waitress goes over the top pushing the most expensive bottle, says only bad things about the other ones, so that if you take a more moderately priced bottle you look cheap, well, I won't say anything at the time but I won't go back.  And there was no chiller, so my very expensive Chardonnay ended up lukewarm.  And no bread.

name: Brandi Johnson
text: Great food and atmosphere

name: Cooper Crippen
text: Very good food but can get expensive quickly

name: Isabel Marques
text: Great wine and amazing food!

name: Chris Clark
text: Had a tasty brunch and Bloody Mary!

name: elaine philyaw
text: I recently had the pleasure of trying one of Mike's amazing pies (chocolate fudge). I shared with my daughter, and she informed me that the peanut butter pie was also fabulous. He and his wife are the kindest people that you will ever meet. Kudos to Mike and his pies!    P.S. great prices also...

resp.text: Wow!  I'm humbled by your review!  Thank you so very much for your kind words, and I'm so glad ya'll enjoyed they pies, too!  :)

name: Brandon Smith
text: A small and top notch pie place with incredible options and incredible customer service! Mike is an extremely polite and sociable individual and his pies speak for themselves! We ordered Pecan, peanut butter, strawberry banana and pineapple cream and each of them were delicious and rich. Prices are very reasonable too!

resp.text: Awesome!  Thank you so very much for the wonderful review! It was a pleasure meeting y’all and so glad you enjoyed the pies! :-)

name: AJ Carlisle
text: Excellent food! Definitely gonna be a regular here

resp.text: Awesome!  Thank you so much! :)

name: Angela
text: One of my absolute favorite places!! The coffee is amazing!! Well everything I've had is great, but the best coffee in town! Quilted pigs, Conecuh bites, breakfast pie, pecan pie, oh heck, just keep going back and find your favorite. You might have several like me!!

resp.text: Awesome!  Thank you so much!!!!!!  :)

name: Brian Jones
text: Great food, awesome people! Super clean! One of my favorites!

resp.text: Thank you!  :)

name: Phylis Otwell
text: Great little hometown place - not a chain. Personalized service, good variety of pies, great coffee, breakfast items, casual relaxing atmosphere.

resp.text: Thank you so much! :)

name: Tommy Watkins
text: My first visit to establishment after viewing on Facebook. The establishment was clean and Mike was really friendly. I ordered bacon and pineapple slices both were fantastic. I look forward to return visit to purchase whole pies.

resp.text: Awesome!  Thank you so much, sir!  Really appreciate the kind words, and look forward to serving you again! :)

name: michelle gober
text: The Toll House pie is my MOST favorite pie!!  Quilted pigs and Conecuh bites are most fantastic too.

resp.text: Awesome!  Thank you so much!

name: total chimp
text: Best pie by far very nice guy, very clean store (pecan pie is the best in the world)

resp.text: Awesome!  Thank you so much!!!!  :)

name: Clint Jones
text: The best pie and the nicest guy

resp.text: Thank you so much, sir! :)

name: Kelli Peek
text: Mike and Alice are amazing! At Pies By Mike, you get delicious food, great prices, amazing service with a feel of family and genuine care for their customer's.  In addition, the atmosphere is great with a relaxing gospel music playing and an at home feel. Definitely don't miss out on delicious dessert pies or breakfast pies!! They also have coffee and pigs in the blankets. You won't regret stopping in!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  :)

name: Tim
text: Closes at noon on SAT. Closed before we could get there, but looking forward to returning soon.

resp.text: Yes, sorry about that.  Our hours actually say we're closed on Saturdays, but we usually open 2-3 Saturdays each month.  Normal hours when we do are 8:30 AM-11:00 AM.  :)

name: Tammy Cloer
text: Absolutely love the pies. Great price also. The owners are very sweet

resp.text: Thank you so much!!!!!  :)

name: Angela Averette
text: Great peanut butter pie

resp.text: Thank you so much!  So glad you enjoyed it!  :)

name: Heather Macias
text: Best pies around! From dessert pies to breakfast pies . Everything is homemade and fresh and the prices are great. The coffee is wonderful too! If you haven't had a Pie by Mike you are surely missing out!

resp.text: Thank you so much! :)

name: Rachel Osborn
text: We love Mike’s!! Hands down my favorite, I drive 45 minutes for some of his pineapple cream pie! Great place for the family.

resp.text: Thank you so much! :)

name: Stuart Herring
text:
Mike always has, as he phrases it, "incrediliciously good" pies.
Toll House, pecan, fudge, strawberry cream, and more---all of 'em well worth your while.
Y'all come eat! :-)

resp.text: Thank you so much, Stuart!  :)

name: Melissa Hand
text: Pies By Mike is AMAZING!!! Best pie, best coffee, best atmosphere! And Mike is pretty awesome too! I would give it 10 stars if I could!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  :)

name: Sherry Calhoun
text: Pies by Mike is the best!  The toll house pie is awesome, I LOVE his coffee, and the company there is even better....thanks Mike and Alice!!

resp.text: Thank you so much!!!  :)

name: Ashley Tucker-Young
text: Great service and amazing pies. Love that you can get pies by the slice!

resp.text: Thank you! :)

name: Shawn Lipscomb
text: Breakfast was awesome and the best coffee in town!  Im so glad to have a breakfast stop on the way to work!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  Was a pleasure meeting you! :)

name: Kyle Stewart
text: Mike is the master of baking absolutely delicious pies. If you can't make a special trip up to Clanton, you'll find a list of stores and restaurants that his pies can be found in. Awesome guy and unbelievable pies.

resp.text: Thank you so much!  :)

name: Carrie Hollar
text: Enjoy this place

resp.text: Thank you so much! :)

name: David Sneed
text: If you are stopping by the flea market on Wednesday you need to make it a point to try the breakfast pies.  They are really good...  Also, keep an eye out for the PBM concessions trailer.  Looks like PBM is about to go mobile...

resp.text: Thank you sir!  :)

name: Tina Potter
text: Good food, friendly,  fast service,  clean

resp.text: Thank you so much!  :)

name: Jessica Shepherd
text: The best pies in Clanton, maybe the world!

resp.text: :)  Awesome!!!!!  Thank you so much!!!

name: Vanessa Norris
text: The pecan pies are to die for!!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  :)

name: Terry Mims
text: Very friendly people

resp.text: Thank you!  :)

name: Kari Osborne
text: I've never had a bad experience here. The food is always flavorful and portions are not small. Be advised that unless you get there very early, you had better be prepared to wait on a table during the weekends.

name: Jason Glass
text: We ordered corn beef hash and stuffed french toast and were quite disappointed.  The potato that came with the toast were cold and hot. The corn beef smelled odd and was not very good. They were nice and did not charge because we weren't satisfied.  I recommend going somewhere else.  Had to go somewhere else for food.

name: Kaila Morales
text: Ive ALWAYS LOVED this place.. and it just got even better! They have recently remodeled the inside with beautiful modern  tables, and floors, and all! Also, they have two new amazing drinks on the menu: Kale Cooler & Pinnapple Tonic. These are fresh squeezed here daily! YUUUUMMM!! Kim (I think a manager) was so kind to check on me and my server Alton was wonderful. I cant wait to come back :) I just LOVE this place :) ♡♡♡

name: Skyi Booker
text: Everything is always cooked to perfection. Much better than IHOP.

name: Heather Gustafson
text: Meh. I absolutely love Eggs Benedict, and so went here to try it out. It was okay. The ham was burnt around the edges, and the english muffin was weirdly toasted... burnt around the edges and soft and fluffy in the middle. The hollandaise sauce wasn't as thick as I like. The food was average. However, they have extremely friendly service and everyone was very kind and helpful.

name: Halie Kawell
text: The food was ok, but the staff was unfriendly. (after we got food we even had to wait on silverware) menu was large, but unvaried . Pretty pricey for what it was. Not a repeat.

name: Lance Moore
text: I was pleasantly surprised with the delicious food and friendly customer service.

name: Alejandra Constante
text: Todo super rico. Delicious. The mánager moved us out from one table to another ans because this minor inconvenience he insisted on paying our bill. The staff is very friendly and food was delicious

name: Richard Magnani
text: Very good breakfast place....

name: Patreon Weeks
text: The customer service was horrible and the food is not all that amazing.

name: Marty Martin
text: Was ok but from what another reviewer said not worth the price.

name: Todd Minch
text: Fantastic breakfast! !

name: Kimyon Lockhart
text: Yummy

name: Ralph Freeman
text:
My wife and I decided to get some breakfast on our way out to roam as we are oft to do. We had been hearing about Brick and Spoon for a while and decided that today was the day to give them a try.
Not surprisingly, Brick and Spoon was busy so we decided to sit at the counter rather than wait the current thirty minute waiting time. After scanning the menu, I decided to order the Killer Creole Omelette with breakfast potatoes and my wife ordered The Grown Up BLT. Our meals were delicious, the waitstaff attentive without overdoing it, the servings of adequate proportions and the prices reasonable. Brick and Spoon won’t be my new go to breakfast spot but I do recommend it and will return.

name: Crystal Mcdaniel
text: Nice atmosphere. Good menu selections. Food is not amazing but still good. Very long wait for the food to be delivered. Not too busy. Easy to get in and out of.

name: Trey Lattier
text: This eatery is amazing. With great service and phenomenal food Brick and spoon delivers my favorite brunch experience in Mobile.

name: Learia
text: Just ate here today!! Wonderful service and the food was AMAZING. The whole restaurant gives off a very relaxing and nice vibe !! Will definitely be making this a new brunch spot.

name: Eva Medina
text: This is a great place. Loved food wait staff very sweet and friendly. Child menu was nice they were happy.

name: Michael Cuesta
text: Good food, not great but good. I've had better experiences at other Brick and Spoon locations.

name: James Oakes
text: Website said pet friendly but they turned us away. Manager said she had no idea it was on the site. I would think if your the mgr. You should know what's on your webpage.

resp.text: I am sorry about this situation. After doing research of what you may have been looking at, it was showing the Orange Beach location. Our Mobile locations were not listed anywhere as pet friendly. Again, I am sorry about this inconvenience.

name: Danielle
text: First experience was HORRIBLE we waited over 40 minutes which was fine. When we finally did get to sit down we had over 15 minutes for the server to actually come to our table  When we set at our table they had the forks just laying on the table not to mention they looked dirty. Then we witnessed the guy in the kitchen rubbing his nose then touching people’s food. We are still in a pandemic the fact that the forks are just throwed on the table and the unsanitary workers is very irresponsible for the management

name: Robert Rhodes
text: Great service and even better food!

name: Trey Holyfield
text: Good but overpriced. Two breakfast entrees and a mimosa = $55

name: Russell Breeden
text: Excellent service and amazing food!

name: Heidi Perez
text: Today was a waste of money, food was bland, deviled eggs were horrible, we did come in close to closing time but that’s when you should be on your toes from the beginning of the day to the end, no matter what!

name: Giovanni Toma
text: Great food great service nice atmosphere nice place

name: Jaron Grantham
text: Best brunch spot around!

name: Savannah Jones
text: I'm very picky about breakfast burritos, and most places get them too greasy and falling apart. But the burrito I had here they toast it like a panini so it doesn't fall apart and it was the best tasting burrito! Sausage, cheese, egg, onions, peppers. I asked for extra cheese and a cup of salsa. Best breakfast I've had in awhile. And it was more than enough, I was worried about not having a side but I couldn't even finish my burrito.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed it! Come see us again soon!

name: Christine Wise
text: Great food, staff and atmosphere. We just discovered this place and have already visited it twice this week. Cheddar biscuits, chicken salad, fried pies all really yummy food. Can't wait to go back and try more stuff on the menu.

name: Kim Story
text: On a whim, I stopped here today to eat lunch. I got the strawberry and pecan salad (which came with an awesome dressing btw) ,and a fried apple pie. It was delicious!!! Will definitely be going back!

name: Jillian Wright
text: Hands down the best place in Arab- or even nearby- to get fried mushrooms. They are the only place that makes them just right!

name: Pam B
text: Delicious food! Very friendly staff with great service!

name: Ann Wright
text: Food was great. Staff friendly and attentive. Perfect spot for breakfast or lunch.

name: susan WING
text: I was so excited to finally be able to stop at the Station Cafe but now I  wish I had never made that stop. I ordered a large hot latte but what I got I have no idea. It was the worst latte I'd ever had. At first I thought it was just weak coffee and the guy just forgot what I ordered but I'm  not sure if it was even that. It was frothy so he got the milk part right I just don't know about the rest of it.  I did think at the time he made it awfully quick and I commented on that to him after all a 2 shot espresso latte takes a few minutes to make. I guess he must of just left out my 2 shots. Waste of $4.  I would have return to cafe but I  was almost home before I tried the drnk and I don't live in Arab.

resp.text: I’m so sorry that you didn’t enjoy your coffee! The gentleman that made your coffee today has many years of experience as a barista and since our opening in May, we’ve  had nothing but positive feedback on anything he’s made. Next time you are in town, we’ll be happy to refund your coffee or make you another one on the house! Again, I’m terribly sorry you didn’t enjoy your experience and we’d love the opportunity to try again!

name: Ivan Croes
text: Great options! Food is delicious!

name: Ducky
text: Absolutely loved it! The food was great and so was the coffee! Wish there had been a little more atmosphere. Some music or something playing would be great!

name: Jeremy K
text:
Excellent breakfast and a reasonable price.
Best sweet treats around. And its locally owned.   Well done Guy's.

name: Stephen Bearden
text: Fantastic coffee! Burgers were delicious!!

name: Malcolm Parsons (KI4KI)
text: Good food, good service, great atmosphere.

name: BulldogReddog
text: BEST COFFEE, I’ve drunk lots of coffee around the place but this is the easily the best for the best price 10/10 the worst part is finishing my coffee

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Michael Cobb
text: Excellent food. The service was impeccable. Prices are very reasonable.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback. We value your business.

name: Ken Priest
text: Just went in to check it out

name: Pocket Bear
text: Food needs help

name: Andra Rutherford
text: Delicious food, great atmosphere, and excellent service!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving your review for our business.

name: Marc Mt
text: Been here to this location enough times now that i feel I can say its a great brunch place. Their grits are outstanding. The Bloody Mary's are fun. Great selection of classic and regional meals. Very good service.

name: Donna Mills
text: The food was absolutely amazing.  We had stuffed french toast, eggs Benedict, and omelet.  All were delicious.  Fast, friendly service also!!  You will be glad you did.

name: Billy Campbell
text: Had a nice breakfast at the new location. We have been to the original Mobile spot several times and it has always been really good. The new Brick & Spoon at Airport and Schillinger did not disappoint. The servers were super nice and friendly. The food was great and came out quick. We will definitely be coming back.

name: Jason F
text: The food is always excellent.  The bartender was nice and bubbly.  The manager always makes sure you have what you need. I suggest making this place a part of your routine.

name: Matthew Damour
text: They have a wonderful menu and the food is great. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. They also serve beer and liquor. Enjoy and be safe!

name: Cary Reams
text: We’ve only been here once, but we’ll definitely be back - the food is great, the staff was super, (we just sat at the bar) - but the bartender did a great job for us - and again - the food was great! No complaints here at all!

name: The SRT God
text: Food was good! Service was good as well! Be prepared to wait tho!! It's a popular place!!!

name: Craig Jackson
text: Not one complaint,  other than needing someone to drive us home... Stuffed. I see why on their site it says "warning food coma food"😄😬😳😴

name: Melvin James III
text: Wasn’t bad. Service was good but a little pricey

name: John Humphries
text: The killer Creole 0omlette was fresh and juicy but short on veggies, hollandase sauce was not lemony and no cheyanne bite.  Skip the crab cake as it was just not good.  The establishment was open, clean and comfortable and the coffee equipment strong.

name: Matthew Henricks
text: This restaraunt is amazing, with friendly staff! The food is all delicious. We got the breakfast tacos and creole omellette and loved them. There was a lot of flavor! Highly recommended checking this place out.

name: Karen Henderson
text: The food is always excellent here.  They have a great selection to choose from, it's always hard to decide because it's all so good.  This is my leftovers today - 1/2 of my Killer Creole omelet.

resp.text: Thanks for visiting! We hope to see you again!

name: Cary Scott
text: Great service, great food. The waitress brought our birthday boy a dessert which was very thoughtful.

name: sara cj
text: The first time we went here was awesome but this time was less than desirable. My husband barely ate his food ( farmers market Benedict). The vegetables were saturated in some type of butter substitute and overpowered the whole dish. I didn’t get my taco sauce until I finished my first taco. The most important thing was our waitress DID NOT WEAR her mask the whole time!

name: Sheila Mcmullen
text: Very nice atmosphere, open floor concept and friendly staff. The menu options weren't as traditional (corn meal batter for pancakes). Overall it was different and fulfilling. I ordered the Caribbean Scrambler.

name: crystal cooper
text: Delicious! Got bananas in pajamas was the best. Beignets were cute and also good.

name: Mohammad Siddiqi
text: Good food and friendly waitress. Long Wait & little pricey

name: Brian Whone
text: Call in order isn't ready within 50 minutes- 2 biscuits for two and an omelet... Not a ton. Stood waiting for 20+ minutes. An offer to sell me a drink while I waited would have been helpful.

name: Antonio Bryant
text: Very Bias, mind you im 6'2 235lbs. I walk in the greeter ask how many I say just one. She says you can sit at the bar. I just want some breakfast. The lady behind the counter sees me walks off, so im patiently waiting to be served. 10 mins later a Caucasian lady walks up to the bar they serve her immediately. 1st time here, and I'll never come back

name: Emily Hartsell
text: This place has great food and great service! I had the crab cakes and fried green tomatoes over cheese grits and loved it. Good coffee too.

name: James Shouldis
text: Have been to this little spot several times over the past few years. The food and service is always great I enjoy having breakfast there especially, but I had lunch this time and I was quite pleased with both the food and the service I suggest anybody give it a try

name: Ashleigh
text: Great food and wonderful service. Love the biegnets and strawberry jam. Very cute place. I could see myself coming back for the yummy breakfast again!

name: Buckridge Noble
text: Visited here on a recommendation from a friend while we were in town. I’m glad we ate here. Such a large selection of interesting and different menu items! We ordered the “breakfast fries” as an appetizer, but we could’ve made that a meal on its own. They were delicious!

name: Isaac Redding
text: Never tried this place before I tried the bayou Benedict and breakfast fries. They were both great but I couldn't get enough of the benadict with shrimp and a special bayou sauce that had a burst of flavor with every bite! Give them a try Thanks!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Isaac!

name: Michelle Willard
text: Why in the world would you add canned corn to your grits? Yes grits is a corn dish but seriously there is no need to reiterate that by adding canned corn to it. The shrimp and grits was disgusting. The first batch of beignets I got, made out of canned biscuits, were raw and the second batch was so over cooked I could have used them as golf balls. Cost to much to be this bad. I don't recommend

name: Bryan Wetzel
text: Great service and great food! (Chicken Florentine pictured)

name: Tricia D. Potter
text: Best grits I have ever eaten. Just delicious. Little spendy but the food quality is worth it. I ordered the Creole omelet... Excellent. Husband ordered Bananas Foster French Toast. His thought:  "Exceptional." Service is relaxed, so if you are in a hurry, either save this place for a time when you can enjoy it, or mention it to your server. (Sorry for the partially eaten food pic. I was so hungry I forgot at first.)

name: Cat Johnston
text: Food always hot and fresh. Everything I have tried so far has been excellent. Awesome customer service.

name: Keena Able
text: My food was cold when I received it but that could have been the delivery drivers fought. I asked for fully cooked bacon and it was not. The grits were nasty. I don't know how you can have a tough, what appeared to be a conecuh. Overall the meal was horrible. This was a second chance that I was given but never again.

name: Darlene Lewis
text: Great experience! Been here several times before. All experiences have been pretty good.

name: LaToya Durosca
text: The food is so good! The staff was wonderful! This is definitely a go to spot for me whenever I'm in AL.

name: Dynamite Cleaner bear
text: Eggs were cold, benigets were meh, Coffee was good.

name: Brigham Schellinger
text: I had the chicken florentine and it was delicious. Complex flavors and it was so rich. I shouldn't have eaten the whole thing but I did. Also free beignets have left me feeling very content. I was also impressed by the cleanliness and atmosphere. No complaints except maybe the check being a little high, but I think it's well worth it.

name: Chanon Zimmerman
text: Everything from the food to the service was spectacular!  Don’t pass up this southern chain restaurant.  Breakfast fries and tacos are on point!

name: Paul Lipscomb
text:
My Eggs > Your Eggs

Firstly, our server was great.  She was polite,  prompt and courteous.

I ordered shrimp and grits.

The egg was overcooked and shrimp followed suit.  Food was plated like overflowing slop.

name: tomasine lewis
text: We've been here twice and each time it didnt disappoint. These pictures are of the ham and cheese omelette with the corn grits; hubby always tops his eggs with salsa. I had the bananas foster with a side of grits (which I didn't need). Great food!!

name: Cecilia Marney
text: The food and the staff was great! Although I waited an extended period of time for my food, the staff accommodated me by allowing my meal to be free. I appreciated the customer service.

name: Dan S
text: Great service and great food. They have a real good eggs benedict.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Cool little nook, using half of the former restaurant's space. The design and the music were the best things. Beignets, bananas in pajamas and bananas foster French toast are nice offerings for Mobile. Came for my daughter, who has been wanting to come since they opened. She is vegetarian, so she did okay. Vegans have slim pickings. They even put milk in THE GRITS. Love the modern vibe, but when they're packed, they may have a noise issue w/nothing much to absorb sound. When you open a breakfast place, you probably need to hire some morning people. Nice break from wall-to-wall TV trend. Interesting morning & lunch cocktail idea, but the bar was quiet. Bar seating could work nicely to grab a bite by yourself. Good luck and Happy One Year Anniversary!

name: Ge Ge M
text: Great staff. Smiling and immediate greeting upon entering. Clean restroom. I got the mimosa trio which I think was fantastic & I tried the wild berry mimosa. I ate the breakfast tacos but mine isn’t made as the menu states due to the E-coli CDC concern. However the tacos was still delicious. The corn grits had a great texture! I love the option on Build your own Bloody Mary, I’ll definitely go back to try that. Parking was simple.

name: Richard Dillane
text: The restaurant was clean crowded and a little short of Staff but they worked hard to make the meal Pleasant. I had the eggs benedict they were good, my buddy had the Fried Green Tomatoes special and he really liked it. Best of all, found a also have one in Biloxi Mississippi which I will visit

name: Jim casey
text: Their Grits are awesome so Creamy. Had the ham and cheese omelet didn't really taste any gouda,it was ok,my Husband had the adult grilled cheese that was really Good. Ate about half my omlete asked for a container for the rest and when I picked it up to put it in  there was small reddish brown HAIR underneath.OMG Grossed me out.we Didnt ask for a refund but the manager knocked 3 bucks off our check kind of a joke. But it is what it is and the COOK needs to wear a net over his facial hair!!!

name: Jeff N
text: For my first time there, I had a pleasant experience. I came during lunchtime on a rainy day and it was quite busy. I did have a hard time trying to figure out what to eat so I decided to go with breakfast. I tried the Bananas in Pajamas as an appetizer and a Killer Creole Omelette for entre. Both items have amazing flavor and were delicious.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review Jeff! We are glad you enjoyed your visit!

name: James Duke
text: We were told there would be a thirty minute wait, however we were seated after about twenty minutes. The coffee was good and hot. Our servers name was Missy and she did a great job the portions were huge and everything was fresh. We especially liked the breakfast tacos. Something different from breakfast tacos you might have had before.

resp.text: We will make sure and thank Missy for giving great service!

name: Victoria Jones
text: The staff was nice. The food was excellent. Will definitely be back

name: Jalen Kent
text: My favorite place for tasty Brunch. It's so delicious. Fast, efficient, and courteous service. The place has a great feel to it. Menu is like a cafe in Boston I liked.

name: Praveen Roberts
text: The place has good ambience, the food is pretty decent , the eggs were cold so were the fries. The hollandaise sauce did not taste like it was made from scratch. Upscale ihop, with liquor.

name: Carol Mellon
text: The adult blt was very good.  The beignets, while not quite like new Orleans,  were good and served with a delicious strawberry sauce

name: ch3mical Genius
text: First time visiting this restaurant. Had a strong taste for an omelette and saw this place was listed for it being on their menu. I was very satisfied with the food and my server. The omelette was delicious and the mimosa really hit the spot too. I'll definitely be coming back to try something different.

name: Nova Kane
text: Awesome place to eat and great friendly staff

name: Theresa Styles
text: I recommend this restaurant. The food is amazing and the portions are huge.

name: Quinta Patterson
text: The food was so delicious and they give you a great bit of food the atmosphere is nice and quiet the hostess and our server was very nice! I would so recommend this place!

name: Samaria Moore
text: Love the food. Never fails

name: Jessica Moore
text: Amazing food, service and atmosphere!! We will definitely be back!!

name: Stacy Jones
text: Never been here before but we wanted a local spot that served brunch and when I googled this place showed up. The website said it was the top 10 breakfasts in the US. There was a 25 min wait but we had time before we needed to get back on the road and didn’t mind the wait. It was good breakfast. The lady at the entrance was nice and welcoming. The waitress seemed tired or something else was off. We gave her a nice tip so maybe that helped her day go better.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Stacy! We hope to see you again!

name: Steven Jones
text: Had a delicious traditional Benedict (poached egg was perfect) with fire roasted grits - although it was packed with customers the service was friendly and attentive!

name: Tee Jay 251
text: For all your brunch needs just delicious

name: Theodore Bridges
text: Great food and service EVEN if they're busy! Good Show!

name: David Godsey
text: One of my new favorite places to eat. Margaret was our server and she is awesome.

resp.text: We are so glad you loved your visit! Come back anytime for top notch service and food quality!

name: Jessica Moore
text: Amazing food, service and atmosphere!! We will definitely be back!!

name: Jim casey
text: Their Grits are awesome so Creamy. Had the ham and cheese omelet didn't really taste any gouda,it was ok,my Husband had the adult grilled cheese that was really Good. Ate about half my omlete asked for a container for the rest and when I picked it up to put it in  there was small reddish brown HAIR underneath.OMG Grossed me out.we Didnt ask for a refund but the manager knocked 3 bucks off our check kind of a joke. But it is what it is and the COOK needs to wear a net over his facial hair!!!

name: Richard Dillane
text: The restaurant was clean crowded and a little short of Staff but they worked hard to make the meal Pleasant. I had the eggs benedict they were good, my buddy had the Fried Green Tomatoes special and he really liked it. Best of all, found a also have one in Biloxi Mississippi which I will visit

name: James Duke
text: We were told there would be a thirty minute wait, however we were seated after about twenty minutes. The coffee was good and hot. Our servers name was Missy and she did a great job the portions were huge and everything was fresh. We especially liked the breakfast tacos. Something different from breakfast tacos you might have had before.

resp.text: We will make sure and thank Missy for giving great service!

name: ch3mical Genius
text: First time visiting this restaurant. Had a strong taste for an omelette and saw this place was listed for it being on their menu. I was very satisfied with the food and my server. The omelette was delicious and the mimosa really hit the spot too. I'll definitely be coming back to try something different.

name: Nova Kane
text: Awesome place to eat and great friendly staff

name: Carol Mellon
text: The adult blt was very good.  The beignets, while not quite like new Orleans,  were good and served with a delicious strawberry sauce

name: Samaria Moore
text: Love the food. Never fails

name: Vanessa
text: I was really excited to eat here, but was disappointed. The beignets were undercooked, my bread for the Benedict wasn't toasted and was just drowned by the flavorless bayou sauce that made it mushier from sitting. It took more than 20 minutes to get our food and as we watched everyone else eat, we were sad to see small portions and other unhappy people. It just wasn't good or worth $38.

resp.text: We are sorry Vanessa! We actually take pride in having good portion sizes. Thank you for the feedback so we can use it to improve on our operation!

name: Kimberly Diane Rouse
text: Food was good and drinks were great!

name: Valencia Shelby
text: The build your own Bloody Mary is the best! The shrimp and grits are my personal favorite.  This is an amazing brunch spot!

name: leigh taylor
text: Excellent food and great service!

name: john sykes
text: Quick seating. Attentive server. Breakfast tacos were yummy.  First visit was 👍

resp.text: We hope to see you for a second visit and maybe even a third!

name: Carl Noe
text: Bananas Foster so good you’ll slap your momma. Great service & atmosphere.

name: Big Pop Productions
text: Service was not bad, slow start though. The place is SUPER noisy. Recommend some sound dampaners in the ceiling be added. Also, there was a dead roach, see picture, would be nice if I were kept in the dark about the roaches. The food was great.

name: Laysea Gardiner
text: Wish I could give it zero stars. Worst service ever. Order drinks and it took 15 minutes to get to us. Ordered food and it took an hour to arrive I will never be coming back here again. I just wasted two hours of my time and paid to have diarrhea.

name: Rita Hubbard
text: Food was excellent and great customer services

name: Marcus Moore
text: As a visitor to the city, it was a nice local spot.   Food had a southern touch but not too down home if you know what I mean.   I ordered the delicious shrimp creole omelet and really enjoyed the accompanying grits.   I would recommend if you are in the area.

name: Ric Flair
text: Slightly above average. I was really pumped to eat here. Kind of a let down.The place was clean but overall unoriginal.The food was not as good as it looks like it would be. If you pay $60 for 2 people to eat breakfast it should be outstanding. Ruby slipper and broken egg cafe are way better.

name: Jennifer McLamb
text: Delicious food, no wait on a Saturday morning at 9am, great service. Super cute atmosphere. Highly recommend!

name: Ricky Dearmon
text: West Mobile location- Understand the wait to be seated for 1/2 occupancy- but at 40 minute wait for food is crazy. Oh yeh just a party of 3

name: Mark Smith
text: Delicious food!

name: marshae davis
text: Sorry this is not a winner for me. The food is pretty bland which makes it not worth the price. The proportion size was really good but my taste buds were not satisfied. I had the shrimp and crab cake pasta and all three of those together sounded so Devine together but ...the mark was missed

name: Derrick L. Vaughn
text: The Spinach, Cheese, Bacon Omelet was exceptionally delicious.👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾

resp.text: Thanks for the great review.

name: kim dove
text: Service was great but the food was less than desirable.

name: Clifford Conklin
text: Great food. Great bloody Mary.

name: Val Graves
text: The food and service were enjoyable. I will definitely be back.

name: Justin Allen 88
text: Great breakfast and awesome service! Jennifer was a great waitress!! If we are ever back this way we will definitely go back!

name: Missy Kamer
text: Absolutely delicious and a lot of food!

name: Javier Perez
text: Waitress was horrible and the food was disgusting. Shrimp and grits resembled dog food. Disgusting to say the least!

name: Johnathon Grauvogl
text: Amazing food and awesome service! Best brunch place I know of.

name: Gary Rose
text: Wonderful little breakfast. A little pricey but well worth the treat. Food was excellent and a great portion. You wont leave hungry. Bloody Mary's and the mimosas are great as well with multiple options

name: Mel iheartpixels
text: Fantastic breakfast. We had SBC Omelet and Creole Omelet. The grits are a-m-a-z-i-n-g

name: Space Duck
text:
Quite a beautiful resturant and very friendly atmosphere! Our server was very efficient and even came our to tell us our food was almost ready! (We got it within 12 minutes, excellent time!!) I ordered the S.B.C Omlette (seen in the fourth picture) and it was so good! The hash browns were cooked but seemed a little off, but still good with some salt and pepper.

There is a bar and they do serve alcohol, for those that want some. Their brunch is amazing!!

Over all, it was a great experience and the staff was very warm and welcoming! Will definetly be coming back here again!

name: C C
text: I don't know what to mixed reviews are about, but the eggs benedict traditional is 🔥 🔥 🔥. The service was great in the espresso was good too. Yum.

name: Anna Mac
text: One of the best burgers I've ever had! The staff was very friendly and the food was delicious, definitely coming back here next time I'm in Mobile!

resp.text: We love to hear you will be back to see us again!

name: Ali Zeidan
text: The food was really good, but the staff was shorthanded, so I think it took away from our experience. However, I believe they will be better the next time if they're not understaffed.

name: Roads Traveled Photography
text: Kinda pricey for what you get. Adorable decorated

name: Shannon DeVita
text: AMAZING food - cool atmosphere and friendly staff. I got the stuffed French toast sliders - so good!

name: ECo1SG
text: Food was great and reasonably priced.

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: Tracy Adegbesan
text: The food was wonderful met the owner very nice will be going back.

name: Cindy Dye
text: We went here on a Tuesday morning and thought it was great.  There was plenty of open seating so we got in right away.  We got the Bananas in Pajamas for an appetizer, and thank goodness we did.  They were fantastic!  My husband and I got the Creole omlet and it was also great.  But definitely get the Bananas in Pajamas if you like bananas!!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the review Cindy! We hope to see you again and again!

name: Joshua Wafer
text: I love bringing my family there. Service is always friendly and threw food is remarkable. They changed their coffee company... which you can tell. I do miss Royal Cup but it's not enough to steer ne away from this place.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! I’m glad you enjoy visiting us, and we will see you again soon!

name: Markelle
text: I had a pretty great experience at Brick and Spoon. We went for brunch and it was pretty packed but we got to sit at the bar so we wouldn't have to wait for a table. The service was pretty fast considering how busy it was! I got the Fresh Catch Benedict and it was delicious. It came with grilled fish, shrimp, poached eggs, an english muffin and the best grits I've ever had. It was amazing. Looking forward to going back and trying more things!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review! you are a rock star!

name: Vin Elson
text: Had a business lunch meeting at this restaurant and I must say the food was delicious. The line was outside the door, so my business partner and I sat at the bar. Great customer service and the food was freshly prepared. I had the shrimp and grits and avocado sandwich with lemonade. Everything was good, food did not take long to come and the waitress did a great job she was very helpful when we were deciding which dish to select. I forgot to take a photo of my dish, it was yummy!

name: J. Craig Dickson
text:
They must have new owners because the coffee was Much Better than before, Food was fantastic and service was great!
Can't wait to go back!
CD

name: Jason&Lyn Harris
text: Very friendly service. And our food was out very quickly. I recommend "devil on the bayou" for light brunch. My buddy had shrimp mac and cheese and was also pleased. Very clean restraunt too.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5 star review!

name: Melissa Sigman
text: Excellent food, cute little place! Jennifer was a fantastic waitress, absolutely perfect service. Super cool menu with a wide variety of choices!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the review Melissa!

name: teresa & christopher hughes
text: The staff and food is amazing!!!

name: Ginger Kelly
text: Great service in the food was excellent it was French Creole it was wonderful

name: Scott Gordy
text: Very good eggs Benedict. One of our favorites breakfast places until recently. The coffee used to be great but they have changed vendors and it now just ok.

name: Jamal Jamal
text: Meh. Friendly staff but the food was Ok at best, definitely not worth the price tag ($ 20 w/ tax). Lack of seasoning was the main issue. You can't assume the shrimp in the shrimp and grits is going to salt the decent portion of grits because it doesn't, it only salts that spoonful.

name: Eric Oliphant
text: Service was great but the food is bland I can see what they are trying to do. It just missed the mark to me.

name: Alandra Coleman
text: Brittany was a horrible server. Someone at the table asked for a coffee. She brought coffee pot to table reach over me and my food did while I was eating and poured hot coffee into the cold coffee. She didn't say excuse me and had an attitude when she was asked to bring a fresh hot coffee instead. She ran through us and was not at all pleasant. She has no manners. I also was not at all pleased with the gratuity that was only told to us after the fact it's automatically applied with a group of 6 or more. The food was not all that good. A $12 salad consists of a salad mix that's less than $3 in the grocery store. Someone sent their eggs back twice after asking for them tk be cooked all the way not running. It was an omelet not sunny side up. My first and last visit. Go Brittany!

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you did not receiver top quality service! This particular server is no longer with us as we move forward with our new owners!

name: Johnny Wales
text: Trendy place, great food, new facility, good staff. Our waiter, Morgan, was really great. Clean and bright and new place. Recommend checking it out. About 12 to 15 a plate, but really worth it. Get the tacos or something with the hollandaise sauce.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the recommendation!

name: Stephanie Brand
text: Today we decided to eat at Brick and Spoon!  We were not disappointed at ALL!  Brittany was such an outstanding waitress.  The food was delicious.  You will not be disappointed with the food at all.  If you can, get Brittany; she makes Brick and Spoon feel very comfortable and welcoming.

name: Megan Neel
text: We gave my future sister in law a shower at The Brick and Spoon in Mobile today and it was AWESOME! We coordinated everything with Shawn. He helped us with all of the details like a limited menu (he even printed them for us), drinks, set up with tables and even suggested doing an after hours shower. We had the place to ourselves and the waitresses were WONDERFUL! They accommodated us with ease (even the picky eaters were happy). The food was absolutely amazing. Every person at the shower (20 people total) agreed that the food tasted perfect and there was PLENTY on each plate. They also made a fresh pot of coffee for us. I can't say enough good things about the staff and waitresses who helped us today. They also make killer Bloody Mary's and mimosas. I highly recommend them for large parties. Call ahead and talk to Shawn. He was excellent.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed your event! Thank you for being a valued customer and if you ever need anything, do not hesitate to call!

name: Brandie Aucoin
text: Absolutely Amazing!!!! The food was so fresh and hot. The mother daughter duo that own the place were amazing, nice and so sweet!!!!

name: Eshala D.
text: Just order via DoorDash. Cobb salad had hair in it and the spring mix has old slimy lettuce in. Called the restaurant and was told that their cook is bald so she has no idea how the hair got in the salad and that the lettuce is supposed to be this color. Wish I could post pics of this!

resp.text: We hope to see you again!

name: Amy Cobb
text: AMAZING!!  AWESOME FOOD. GREAT SERVICE. We had the pleasure of enjoying this local eatery today for brunch. Would highly recommend. So many choices on the menu, will be going back very soon!!!!

name: Robert H Wright Sr (Bobby)
text: Service is all ways on point. Traditional eggs benedict were a little off. Eggs where hard-boiled and the hollandaise sauce was practically a no show, Very dry.

name: Aavery Mundt
text: Great franchise breakfast spot.  Similar to first watch.  Excellent food and good service, great for breakfast or brunch.

name: Jake (Roadrunner)
text: Great food. Waiter was very friendly, nice, and professional. I recommend this place to anyone wanting a good breakfast.

name: Alexis Yount
text: Incredible omelets and very photogenic french toast.  Everything was amazing.  Service was excellent.  The intersection to get here was a little exciting, but it was worth it.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review Alexis!

name: Tony Traylor
text: Great breakfast and great service. Many items on the menu I want to try. I’ll be back. Thanks!

name: Nghia Huynh
text: Good small chain for brunch-style foods inspired with local ingredients. They offer a good variety of classic breakfast and brunch options with their own twists. Their sweet options were much better than their savory, so I recommend those such as the french toasts.

name: Ben Gallamore
text: We have been here before and its been crowded, so we are fine with waiting for food. We went this morning and it was not very crowded and we were seated right away. It took a LONG time to get our food. When they brought the food they brought smoked sausage as supposed to breakfast sausage which i ordered. When I told the waitress it was wrong, she pulled out her notebook and said no you said smoked sausage. I know what i said, and i don't appreciate being talked to like a 4 year old. This place is way overpriced for the food quality and the service you receive.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Ben. We are now under new ownership and have had a training course with our servers on how to properly handle complaints. We are sorry she talked to you that way and we can assure you it wouldn't happen again!

name: Janice Robinson
text: Excellent food and service!

name: Jeanue Shoemaker
text: They are reusing their paper menus and the table was dirty when we sat down. While coronavirus is still out there isn’t the point of having paper menus for sanitary purposes and for them to be thrown away after a single use? They were very difficult to read as well. Staff was friendly.

name: Bonita Dungan
text:
It's okay. The service was lacking and we got there before the Saturday Brunch rush. I filled my my own water twice and the beverage station.

The food was okay, definitely not up to par with all the hype I heard about the place.

name: Rae Arnold
text:
Don't judge this book by its cover. Yes the food is nicely presented however.. .don't expect a hot breakfast. 3rd times a fail. A great concept and great change to the waffle houses of the world. But I don't know about you but I expect my eggs to be hot not cold/lukewarm for the 1000's of bacteria to grow nicely and make me suffer later on in the day. Out of the 3 dishes we ordered today quite literally the only thing that was hot was the French fries that were part of a starter. Once again I gave into the idea of this place and convinced myself that it would be a nice change for a day off with my teen. The service was better at my grandmother's wake. To say we were an afterthought is being gracious. The waitress on numerous occasions say our full plates and not once were we asked if everything was alright. (She seemed a little more concerned about the large table that sat after us). So shame on her, having been in the restaurant business my whole life I am one of the ones you want with my 30-40% tips.
If you go for breakfast to this place remember you are throwing the dice and I hope that your money is well spent and that you don't end up in bed from the lack of good food practice.

name: Doug Mills
text: Great food. Quick service. 5 of us that all orders are different. 4 out of 5 said great. Pancakes were not a hit but everything else was awesome.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback! We have changed our pancake recipe and hope you come back and give us another shot!

name: Jordan
text: I come here all the time and I love this spot. I met the GM today and he couldn’t have been more gracious. Morgan, my server, was delightful. Try this one.

resp.text: It was nice to meet you and we hope to see you again!

name: Dan Woo
text: I absolutely love this place. Great food. Friendly staff and wonderful service.

name: Latasha Willis-Jones
text: My husband and I wanted to go enjoy my last day off for SPRING BREAK and we decided to eat at Brick & Spoon. Ashley, our waitress, was extremely nice and helped us on making good decision making for our food. Thanks Ash!!!  The food was very flavorful, and the wait time was short. The food was hot and good.

name: missy fain
text: Rating this Restaurant a one is more than they deserve. The hostess was the rudest! My grandson and myself were on a 15 minute waiting list. After 15 minutes the hostess said ...I hope you don't mind sharing a high top table with another couple. When I politely told her that I would rather not...she rudely said...that's fine but your wait starts over again. I see that it is now under New Management, maybe they should clean house and start new!

resp.text: Hi there Missy. We, the new owners, have removed those who do not give top notch service to our customers! If you give us another chance, you will not be disappointed!

name: Amy J Roberts
text: Phenomenal Breakfast! My fiance and I have been two Sunday mornings in a row, which is uncommon for us, and we have enjoyed ourselves each time! The Bananas Foster French Toast is absolutely delicious!! Our server both times was Margaret, who is very friendly and wasted no time in refilling my coffee! She even took a few moments to chat with us! If I-Hop has become as horrendous to you as it did to us, try Brick & Spoon! You won't be disappointed!

resp.text: Thanks for your awesome review Amy!

name: Latikki Reed
text: Love this place food was amazing and the waiter was delightful. Perfect for brunch with my family.

resp.text: We are so glad you had a good visit and hope to see you again!

name: veronica tillman
text: We went on a Saturday morning (around 9 AM). We were seated right away. The hostess sat us in the backroom, which was fine because the main dining room is so loud. Our server was great! Our food was fast and hot. He was very attentive and didn’t make us feel rushed at all. Probably would rate 5 stars except it was so cold in that room. Hostess tried to sit 3 tables while we were eating and all 3 requested other seating because of the room temperature. Thankfully, we had the “trusty beach towel” in our Jeep 😆

name: L Ross
text: The service was fast and friendly.  The food was good and reasonably priced

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Glad you enjoyed it, and we hope to see you again soon!

name: Russell Breeden
text: The prices may seem above average, but the quantity and quality is exceptional!!

resp.text: Thanks for the review! Glad you enjoyed your visit!

name: Rick Spurgeon
text: Good food, good service but small portions.

name: David Godsey
text: One of my new favorite places to eat. Margaret was our server and she is awesome.

resp.text: We are so glad you loved your visit! Come back anytime for top notch service and food quality!

name: Ashley Ellis
text: My husband and I stopped in around lunch time. The food was great!!! We were seated quickly. The service could have been a bit better. Ran out of drink a few times and my husband ask for some mayo right after the food came out. The waitress apparently forgot because she never returned until she brought the bill. She stood behind the bar talking the rest of the time. Would have been 5 stars if the service was a little better.

name: Liza Mesezhnikov
text: Disgusting food and horrible service. We ordered the burger and bayou Benedict. They never gave us any drink refill and never came back to our table. We waited 45 minutes for the food and it came out cold and they forgot the bacon on the burger, charged me 5 dollars for 1 piece of French toast that I ordered instead of the grits and it was hard and old. Mind you by this point it was us and another family in the restaurant that’s it. Waitress came out with the burger gave us attitude and left and never came back. Someone else brought out the other food like 15 minutes later. Then we waited another 10 minutes and no one brought silverware until the busboy saw that we were looking around for any waitress for help getting silverware and brought us some. The waitresses were still no where to be found. Avoid this place at all costs. The food was really bad also, not fresh at all. Def not the best breakfast or lunch, it wasn’t even mediocre

resp.text: We are sorry to hear you did not enjoy your visit! As you can see from the other reviews, we rarely disappoint. If you give us another chance, we will show you why we are so successful!

name: Y G-Drumming
text: I came for the Bread Pudding.....It was hard & dry..seemed like old biscuits...not kewl...traveled far for this.

resp.text: We currently do not have bread pudding on the menu. Can you explain this to me more? I want to fix your experience with us, and make sure we make necessary changes we need too. Thank you!

name: David Clark
text:
Great breakfast place
Brick & Spoon began in Lafayette, La and and their origin is reflected in the menu. They  have several Creole and Cajun-inspired  selections. And they specialize in Bloody Marys with a huge selection of items to select from to build your very own concoction.
Everything I have tried has been very good. If you are looking for something different and visually impressive, I would suggest the French toast sliders.
They are only open for breakfast and lunch (no dinners) and there is often a wait during peak times.

resp.text: Thanks for the review David! See you Soon

name: Jessica Templeton
text: This place is incredible! The killer creole omelette and the breakfast tacos were outstanding! Don’t forget about the mimosa trio. Service was impeccable and the atmosphere was perfect. Five stars doesn’t do this place justice.

name: N H
text: The service was amazing and at 830am on a Saturday there was no wait. I had the Bananas Foster French toast and my friend had the American breakfast. We both shared an order of Truffle fries. I can't wait to go back for brunch on a day when I'm not working so I can try the mimosas.

name: Amber McCann
text: This is a great place to eat! The atmosphere is fun. The fire roasted cheese grits are AH-MAZING!!

resp.text: We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your visit! We hope to see you again!

name: Zash
text:
1. Dining area seemed clean.
2. Staff were nice and attentive to drink refills etc. And food arrived freshly fixed and warm.
3. Mens restroom seemed clean but needs some repair TLC.
4. Some reviewers mention loud noisy guest for the noise. Our experience was the place is inherently noisy by design. There no doubt IS a NEED for the owners to install strategically placed noise absorbing decor hanging from ceiling etc..(there are companies that specialize in this solution).
5.. I ordered the Grown-Up grilled cheese sandwich(photo attached). Sandwhich was pretty good but this isn't a grilled cheese sandwich. It's really a BLT with cheese & egg added in  which the tomatoes were VERY  (un-ripe white). It was a nice change from a fastfood burger though.
6. The bill...2 of us ate here. My wife got the biscuits with a side of extra bacon. Total was $28+tip.
7.We will likely come back. If this is to be a breakfast brunch type place they do need to explore noise cancelling panels along the ceiling or other key areas to knock the noise down.
8. We enjoyed our meal.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback on your experience. We, the owners, have only been here for a few weeks and we are working to absorb the noise level and are also working on making repairs across the restaurant. We have many other options, other than the grown up grilled cheese, that our customers love and we hope you give us another try!

name: Lori Santana
text: Great place to gather with family and friends.. six of us dined there this morning, Sunday Bloody Mary is killer.. you can build your own..but their mix is what makes it delish.. nice selection of specialty mimosas as well.. incredible menu selections for breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner.. we shall return

resp.text: We will see you when you return!

name: derrick todd
text: It's a pretty good place. I like the atmosphere in the ambience. My sister eats there on a regular basis so it must be good

resp.text: Thank you for your review Derrick!

name: michael diaz
text: Came here with a friend and had no idea this place existed I got eggs Benedict and he got the breakfast tacos. The service was good and the food was better. So here I am again and I see the owner is right in the front working as hard as any of the employees. Real nice guy too. This place is extremely good and I will definitely come more often!

resp.text: Thanks for your kind words Michael!

name: charlton Thompson
text: Great experience. Food was delicious. Highly recommend the soft shell crab benefit. Our server Jennifer was awesome! Will definitely be back again soon.

resp.text: thanks for the review! We will make sure to let Jennifer know how well she is doing!

name: Sandra Campbell
text: Southwest burger was great!  Very friendly staff.  Edward was very attentive and friendly  even though we came in just before closing.   Thank you

text: This place is simply awesome.   Great food.  Friendly staff.  Convenient location.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 stars!

name: Patricia Smith
text: This is my first time visiting Alabama. I must say my experience with Brick and Spoon was very rewarding. The food and customer service was excellent. We had a very big party and they treated. Us like Kings and Queens.

name: James Willbanks
text: Our server, Missy, was awesome!! We got the truckers breakfast and built our own blood Marie's. I have to say, we where blown away. Keep up the good work!

name: stephane foots
text: From the moment we walked into this restaurant our service was bad. First off, we walk in and there was a family waiting and no one at the kiosk to greet us. Finally we sit and waited for our table.. then when we was seated at our table and order our food and drinks , the waitress never came back. We sat and waited for our food for 30 mins, no waitress came to check on us, no sorry about our wait or anything. Finally we get our silverware from the greeter and then our waitress stops by and says, “your food is next” then proceeds to walk off not asking if we needed anything. When we get our food, my husband’s order was wrong and my bananas foster was undercooked and I was eating the batter... I told them my order was wrong and then the waitress took it back and immediately brought out another plate proving that she handed us the wrong order. Then the couple beside us had their entire order delivered to another table and so they called out the manager and when he agreed they didn’t have to pay for their coffee he came to our table and was yelling at US saying, “well sorry we lost a cook this morning I’ll just take something off your ticket” he then stormed off and slammed the kitchen door and everyone looked at us! It was so embarrassing and very poorly handled. When the check was corrected, the greeter handed it to us, we never saw the manager or waitress again. It was by far the worst place we have ever been.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear your experience was so poor! We are under new ownership and have changed the way we handle all complaints. If you give us another chance, we can show you what Brick and Spoon is all about!

name: Vaché L. King
text: First time here and LOVED it! Thre only reason we went just one time was we had to get back on the road and was concerned we would have the itis getting back on the highway home.

name: Bud Bush
text: Busy, busy on weekends...make reservation after about 10 am.  Great breakfast and brunch. Our server was super attentive but not obtrusive.

name: Luke Hildreth
text: Service was great food I'm not a fan of at all just average at best but with that said they are packed and 20 are so people waiting to get in. I eat on sunday about lunch 2 omelettes creole and spanish maybe just not my thing. You are packed for a reason

resp.text: Thank you for your review! I would like to ask what you ate while visiting, if you don’t mind? We always want to make sure you have the best experience!

name: Tashara Ciera
text:
The over all taste of the food was delicious. The portion was tremedous, price meets value here! Our server Russ was excellent. He was patient, considerate, helpful, he offered suggestions, and mainly attentive!
We enjoy locally owned establishments, could easily become our Breakfast go to for Saturday Morning.

name: Hilary Bassett
text: always have a good experience at the Brick! Missy has been our server multiple times and she's wonderful. always has a smile! Food was hot, delicious and there was no wait. definitely a repeat spot for us for breakfast or brunch.

name: Julia FM
text: I've wanted to go to Brick and Spoon for months, I've heard so many wonderful things and I was sorely disappointed. We were seated in a dark corner at a table too small for four adults and two high chairs, it felt like they wanted us out of the way. (When we go to brunch, we go early so as not to interfere with the brunch rush since we are dining with children.) I asked what kind of fruit juice they offered and I was told pineapple juice - I ordered a glass and instead got an apple juice. I took one bite of my food and left it untouched on my plate (and declined a take out box) our server never asked if anything was wrong with it. The food was disappointing, the service was disappointing, the whole experience was just disappointing.

name: Rhyan6969
text: I had very high hopes for this place. But the food wasnt very good. The parmesan fries came with just a blob of melted cheese on top which didnt even stick to the fries and the muffins on the eggs Benedict were hard as a rock. I dont think I'll be going out of my way again to go here.

name: Antonio Sampson
text: Great food, slow service.

name: Lisa Peacock
text: I had the eggs benedict my husband had biscuits and gravy

name: Bran Minster
text: Delicious and the drinks are so, so good... And a little strong, mmhm!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are so glad you enjoyed your experience. Come back and see us soon!

name: Harvey Mellard
text: Food is always high quality and delicious! Service is excellent and staff super friendly! I make habit to stop by every so often because it's a bit pricey, but that hasn't stopped me yet

name: Orlando England
text: The FOOD here was absolutely "DELICIOUS"!!! I would strongly recommend the "CALI BURGER" to those that are TRUE burger lovers and add a fried egg to it for a TASTE that'll blow you away!!😀😋👌👍👏👏❤💯

resp.text: We hope to see you again! Thanks for 5 stars!

name: Courtney
text:
Mother's Day Brunch Fail

I called Brick & Spoon 3 weeks prior to Mother's Day weekend to inquire about their meeting room. I was informed by an employee that they do not take reservations for the room on Saturday, only during the week. However, I was intrigued by the pictures online and wanted to see the room in person as well as to see if something could be worked out. Upon arriving, I was told again by the same girl I had spoken to previously that the room could not be reserved on Saturday. Although, she mentioned that if my party and I arrived at opening time we could possibly get the room. On 5/12, I arrived at 8:00 with decorations in tow but only to be informed by the owner that not only was the meeting room RESERVED but also there were THREE RESERVATIONS on the books for that day, one of which was paid! When I explained to the owner about how his staff had lied to me and how I was never given the option of a paid reservation he was less than bothered and unsympathetic. He only offered to seat us anyway as if he was doing us a favor. The manager eventually came out because my guests were upset and wanted an explanation as well. We never got one and neither the owner or the manager ever apologized to us or reprimanded the server I dealt with who just so happened to be working that day. As a result, my guests and I ended up leaving. I host different events throughout the year but I will never again consider Brick & Spoon for an event. The staff lacks integrity and are incapable of showcasing empathy or real concern for customers.

name: Anna Demyanik
text: I was pretty darn excited to try some southern food, especially grits! Everyone talks about the flavor and goodness of the South. Bland meals for both me and husband. Great service, but don't come for the food.

name: Romero Stevens
text: I think the quality of food is still great and the service is as well. The dishes were super dirty

resp.text: Thank you for your review! I am glad the food and service was good, but I am very sorry for the experience of the dishes. We have taken this feedback to be sure we are doing our absolute best all around!

name: David Ahmuty
text: Great food. I mean really good. Friendly staff. Clean and bright. There is pride of ownership here

name: Martin Morales-Rios
text: I'm going to give 4 stars to the food and 2 stars to the place cause was dirty under the tables, I have to wait to long for a togo box and my check.

name: Maria Lloyd
text: Ate the pancake and bacon meal. It literally came out MINUTES after I ordered. I was astounded. Even my server stated “This has never happened before, but your food is ready.” Needless to say, it was spectacular! My server was excellent. She checked on me enough to make sure my glass wasn’t empty. The owner walked around and checked in on everyone as well. Since I received my meal so quickly, I stayed for another hour or two to work. The WiFi was perfect — didn’t require any special login or my email address. It was super fast. I will return. This place is worth the hype.

name: Pam Fredelake
text: Food was good. Service was good.   But very LOUD

resp.text: Sorry for our customers being loud. Unfortunately, we can't control that but we will always offer you great food and great service!

name: Monika Johnson
text: What can I say.... Mimosas anyone?!? Very cute place. Great breakfast options. Pancakes are HUGE! Service was great. Will be going back.

name: Clinton Hernandez
text: I had an hour to kill before a 9 am class so opted to eat a nice breakfast around 7:30 am. It was not very crowded. No hostess was at the stand and no one was at the bar so it was a good 5 minutes before I was seated. Waitress was very good. I got the pecan brie bruschetta and then the cajun omelet with grits. Very good. Several pieces of shrimp. Good coffee. Perfect timing as far we eating and getting to my class.

name: Ayanna Payton
text: French toast & Bacon is the Best,, potatoe hashbrowns was great also

name: Rodney Fortner
text: We were in Mobile for a Carnival cruise and had brunch here. I actually had trouble ordering because everything on the menu looked so great. Settled on what may have been the best shrimp and grits I have ever had. Also shared an order of beignets that were fantastic. Had to wait a few minutes for the table but the wait was worth it.

name: roblox. jyjy
text: The food was delicious

name: Angel Serene
text: The atmosphere of this place was very chill and relaxing. There is the usual bolster of the crowd, but the decor helps make for a relaxing experience. Service wise the performance was lacking. The servers appeared to lack enthusiasm for their job. Service was slow despite the crowd not being very big. Part of our order did not come without verbal reminder, and no offer of cream and/or sugar with my coffee which I would expect at a breakfast place. It made me question if the food would be worth the cost. However despite a lack in service, the food was pretty good. I can say it was worth the price we paid. You could tell the difference between Brick and Spoon and IHOP. So kudos to the kitchen staff for an awesome job on the food. If they improve the front of the house service this place would be a great breakfast hangout. I would come again.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! I love getting feedback in order to improve daily! My name is Shawn Hosey and I am the GM. We hope you come again for a visit and give me a shout when you get here so we can take care of you! Thanks again for the review.

name: Aimee Barresi
text: Poor customer service! I went when they first opened and sat at the bar with my 17 year old daughter and had a great conversation with the owner. Been back numerous times. Went today and asked the hostess if my son and I could sit at the bar and eat lunch hostess said ,”sure! First come first serve! “ We were ignored by the bartenders. I had to get up and ask the hostess for a menu. Still no greeting, no service, I finally brought my menu back and told the hostess that we were never greeted. She said that the reason we were ignored by all of the employees was because my son was with me. Didn’t I sit and speak with the OWNER with my 17 year old daughter? TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! Rude hostess. Such a shame because the food was always excellent. Will take my business elsewhere.

name: Ashley Newton
text: This is a wonderful bistro featuring fabulous breakfasts/brunch, lunch and dinner.  This rrstaurant features wonderful original culinary delights and some great homestyle favorites.  They have some of the most fantastic omelettes!  You can even create your own custom Bloody Mary.  Make sure you try this local gem.  You will not be sorry!

text: Greeter with blue hair was a great person and smiling. Food was good, but our waitress was a hot mess. If it weren't for another waitress who offered her assistance, I wouldn't consider coming back. Whoever she is- Thank you!

name: Courtney Wolfe
text: The 1st time I went here I was super stressed. My husband was in the hospital & I was looking for non fast food and non hospital food (we'd been there for awhile). I went to the bar to place my to go order. The woman, wish I remembered her name, was so nice. After I ordered she asked if I was ok, I'd been crying, I just said yes. She went to put in the order & brought me a glass of water and told me if I needed anything before the order was ready to get her. Since we've been back a few times. The food taste YUMMY and the servers like good people.

resp.text: This above and beyond customer service is what we strive to give every single day!

name: Trish Camp
text: Waited almost an hour to get seated for breakfast even though there were several tables open. Food was good, but not worth an hour wait for it nor the price we paid. I'll stick with Spot of Tea for brunch.

resp.text: Sorry to hear this!

name: Zachariah Barber
text: Some of the best food I've ever had.

resp.text: So glad to hear this!
