resp.text: Thanks for visiting Brick and Spoon. Our service times have improved as our new owners have came in and made service times our focus. Our food is fabulous as always! We hope to see you again!

name: Schuyler Powell
text:
HOT DAMN! MOBILE BEST BREAKFASTS PLACE IS HERE!

Okay so initially when I heard there was a place called Brick & spoon I'm thinking that this place is going to have brick walls and a spoon on every table. To my surprise this is one of the most modern restaurants in Mobile this place looks beautiful I actually came there underdressed thinking I was going to some mom-and-pop restaurant with the capability of cooking good food. Speaking of food the shrimp and grits is actually better than the shrimp and grits on kitchen and George Street I couldn't believe it I actually think one of the best restaurants in Mobile actually has a contender. You guys really need to keep up the good work. The prices are a little high but the food is worth it without a doubt I would rather than have the prices high and good food then lower the prices and it change the quality. I could not afford to eat breakfast there every day but I could afford to eat breakfast at three to four times a week and it is so worth it I am really thinking about budgeting in eating breakfast there in my monthly budget. They also use waitr. Mobile get in where you fit in don't let this one slip out of your hands. Get your brick and your spoon and enjoy hitting them together while you eat. I really don't think you're supposed to do that there but I hope it starts a trend!

resp.text: We love your review! Its nice to see hard work pay off!

name: Markell Jones
text: Came highly recommended and had high hopes. The waitress/bartender was not very welcoming. She wasnt helpful. Was more preoccupied cleaning a spot on the counter and walking off to eat. Another server left his area to answer my questions and help me order. I ordered my food it was lukewarm, bland and topped with wilted and old veggies. It was a complete disappointment. My fiancee became ill. Needless to say that is my first and very last visit.

name: Brandi Marino
text: Went in around 8 this morning for breakfast and wasn't able to get service. Three employees were sitting around a table and did not greet me nor offer that they would be with me momentarily. I waited around for a little while, after it was clear that they had no desire to help me, then I left. This was my first visit. I am very disappointed.

name: Andrea Curtis
text: Well, we called once yesterday and twice this morning to get information and make reservations. No answer - to any call. Surprising at a grand opening no one was answering the phone. We went elsewhere

resp.text: Sorry to hear you couldn't get a call in to us! Hope you give us a try one day! You won't be disappointed!

name: Bambi Sharpe
text: Was in town for the Mardi Gras festivities and googled top restaurants.  Decided to try this out the place.  Was not disappointed.  Great food, service, and several flavors of mimosas!!!  We tried the banana in pajamas, oyster deviled eggs, and breakfast tacos.  Great atmosphere, great service, music, and TV.  Thanks Brittany for making our experience great!

resp.text: We are very glad you enjoyed your visit and hope to see you again!

name: crazykoolme05
text: Great for brunch! Food fresh and very tasty. My advice is to get there before 11am on Saturday's because the line is long.

resp.text: So glad you enjoyed your visit! thank you!

name: Brent Taylor
text: Solid brunch place with a Gulf Coast/Cajun flair. Portion sizes are HUGE, so get ready to take some to go or else feel bad the rest of the day

name: Scott Chancer
text: Great service. Best omelet I've had in years. Food was fresh and cooked to order.  Pricing was fair.

name: Laura Sinclair
text: The food is really good but it's kind of crammed inside. There's not a lot of room between the chairs that are back to back and the tables are a little short, therefore the chairs side by side are close together when you have a party of 5 or 6 people.

resp.text: We are very glad you enjoyed your visit! Thanks Laura

name: chi pham
text: Upon arrival I was very excited to go for the first time to try out Brick and spoon and more excited that they were not busy when we walk in. We were seated right away but we had to wait 45 minutes before we can get our food and when the food came out it was cold. It was not hot at all. My husband order the American breakfast and i had the Banana French toast. He is the kind of person who would not like to complain about anything and just said we will just never come back but I’m the kind of person if something is not right let them know so they can fix it. We told the server she called the manager to come out. When the manager came, he didn’t seem happy. When we told him what happened, his reply was “ what you what me to do about it?” with an attitude. My husband said “don’t worry about it!” and turn to me and said again we will not come back.

resp.text: We are truly sorry this happened and that you were treated that way! This is not the Brick and Spoon way! My name is Shawn and I am the GM. I would love to speak with you about your experience at our restaurant! Please give me a call at your earliest convenience!

name: Jim Cagle
text:
Missy was our server and was excellent.

name: Sandra Elliott
text:
Breakfast is usually my least favorite meal; the food is usually dull even when edible. Brick & Spoon claimed to serve ‘no boring breakfasts.’
Wow! I can’t remember ever enjoying breakfast this much. But let me start at beginning. The staff was pleasant and professional: hostess, waitress, table, buster—all the best. Next, coffee: fresh, aromatic and tasty. They have a long menu of coffee drinks that should make Starbucks cry. OJ, excellent. If you are a Bloody Mary fan, you will be in paradise with the ability to customize your favorite with a parade of optional ingredients. Pineapple Mimosa whispered in my ear, and it was a welcome opener for my day.
We started with bruschetta. It was a taste of perfect balance of crunchy, tart, sweet—indescribably delicious.
My husband wants ‘regular breakfast.’ The American of 2 eggs and sides was cooked perfectly: fluffy scrambled eggs, sour dough toast, heavenly bacon (crisp, the perfect thick-ish, non greasy, with marvelous taste) — and, absolutely the best grits I have put in my mouth in my 67 years — and that is a LOT of grits from a lot of different cooks. If you are new to grits or just think you don’t like grits, don’t miss your chance to taste them here — but do order them ‘plain’ so that you can experience want diners deserve in grits. Many cooks have grits on their menu but sadly, do them poorly. Save the cheese and other options for after you know what grits SHOULD taste like!
Growing up near New Orleans, we could not resist beignets; again well done and worthy as a delightful finish to a memorable meal.
Give Brick and Spoon an opportunity to make some delicious memories for you!

text: Food was hot, fresh and to the table quickly! Service was awesome! Multiple employees checked on us throughout our meal.

text: Date of visit: 11/25/18 Sun 8a server Morgan.  Occupancy on arrival 2 tables.  Occupancy on departure 5 tables.  The good news:  if your looking for a clean restaurant this is it.  Also, the grits are great.  On the other hand, read on.  I had the American Bkfst and my wife ordered the Shrimp Creole Omelette.  When Morgan delivered food we noticed that the Omelette did not have the specified Hollandaise Sauce.  No problem, Megan took it to the kitchen and returned it with Sauce.  Finally we began eating our together as I had already started and as others reported my American Bkfst could have been delivered at a better temperature.  After starting on the omelette my wife said she had no shrimp, upon futher inspection we discovered it to be a ham and cheese omelette and told Megan...oooops I must have picked up the wrong one...no kidding.  Upon which she left and immediately delivered the Shrimp Creole Omelette, now it doesn't take a rocket scientist to know that that dish Sat up there when my dish was prepared.  My wife said that she would keep the ham and cheese omelette since she had started on it.  How can you not get this right the dishes don't look alike.  We didn't know the difference until she delivered the correct dish...ooops.  i.e.cold food poor service..additionally how can a bkfts restaurant IN THE SOUTH have one choice for hot sauce and for bread you get either a biscuit, white toast or English muffen...not in my world, so never again.

Wife ordered the "Biscuits for Two" with a side of gravy and I ordered the "Traditional Eggs Benedict" with Hash browns and a Bloody Mary.  Wife enjoyed her meal, mine was slightly problematic. The eggs benedict were skimpy on the hollandaise sauce and the English muffins were not toasted (No crunch, texture was a bit gummy). NOT what I am used to. Will know on our next visit so that these issues can be prevented.  The hash browns were greasy and not browned. The waitress noticed the hash browns and immediately put in the order for a replacement.  Best part of my meal was the Bloody Mary. All in all, not a total disaster, but also nowhere near perfect. We will TRY them one more time before making final judgement.

text: Went in this morning for a rare breakfast out ... Scott was the waiter very friendly and outgoing  the cook did a great job with my food...but when the women who came in as we got our food and started to eat started yelling at Scott and was doing it with no regard to the three people in there trying to enjoy our breakfast...so a word of advice if you like listening to people being berated and totally embarrassed this is your kind of place ...if on the other hand you like me would rather if she had a problem with one of her employees she should take him to the back and talk to him with respect and treat him like a human being...and if she is not happy with his performance fire him...but the way she treated him I won't treat a dog...so I will never be back and hopefully if enough business is lost the owner will find a decent manager

text: The food was good fast and service was friendly.. Ann Marie  is one of best waitress  I have encountered  in years. Her smile makes you feel welcome and her attitude is the best.. She makes you feel at home here and for a Trucker that means allot.. Keep up the good work...

name: Tim Darnall
text: Terrible experience after waiting 45 mins for food. They had all our orders mixed up. They were out of French fries. My Turkey sandwich smelled like fish. Will never return. Needs shut down or I highly recommend better managing.

name: Ann Hampton
text: If you are African American please do not stop by here. My husband and I was never properly greeted. Our food was half  cooked. Our waitress Amanda completely ignore us. The grits were thick, and disgusting. I also went online submitted the promo code for the survey  and complained. I submitted a complain on Google,  yellow pages app, and Facebook under the Huddle house and Lincoln, Alabama. Someone from huddle house will be calling soon and I will complain again. If you are black please RUN. I was hungry when I arrived and I was starving when I left.

name: Angela Downey
text:
The waitress was nice. The coffee was good.
Other than that it was a terrible experience.  All of the food was cold except the waffle but probably because we had them remade because they weren't dark enough.
I had to send back the eggs because they were over easy instead of over medium. The remake still wasnt cooked enough. The butter on the toast didn't melt because it was so cold. You'll be wasting your hard earned money eating here.

name: Lake Kraken
text: Hair in my food. Bugs on the window sill. Ordered onion rings and my brother got them with his order and I got tater tots. They didn't have fries. Also mixed our orders up. Never coming here again. Around 12 o clock.

name: daniel larson
text: Although some of the staff was friendly, they tried to make me pay for food I did not order.   I left and left the food. I've been in this store a few times and its always hit or miss.  Mostly miss. This was the last time I will visit. Instead, go to the 24 hour diner next door. A little more price wise and takes a little longer for them to cook your food, but the food is better and always nicer staff.

name: Haleigh Hayes
text: Great cooks and good food. You can tell that the staff here needs better leadership. Everything was great but it seems like a couple of waitresses didn't know the menu.

name: Ronda McBride
text: We've been coming to this Huddle House every summer for 19 years...and have always loved it. But today was a very different experience.  They seemed to be short-staffed...at least I hope that's all it was because the service was bad and the food was even worse.   (And the men's restroom was a health hazard.)  I'm not sure if we'll be back.

This used to be a good place to eat, not fast by any means, but good. They need more workers, or better workers, or something. The waitress behind the counter was crying, literally tears rolling down hear cheeks, crying to a customer about how every other phone call was an order. Really!? It's  a restaurant, you should expect orders coming in.
